body: Plastic ban ordinance in Newtown Township years in the making. Newtown's initiative to curb plastics: Newtown Township latest municipality to eye reduction in single-use plastics In early 2022, The township Environmental Advisory Council drafted an ordinance to ban single-use plastic bags, joining Doylestown and Solebury as Bucks County municipalities that have either passed or are considering ...
readable_content: Yahoo News (2023-12-08): The Newtown Township in Bucks County is considering a ban on single-use plastic bags, utensils, and straws. The ordinance, if passed, will go into effect on April 9, with a 120-day grace period for businesses to comply. The penalties for violations include a written warning for the first offense, a $50 civil penalty for the second offense, and fines of up to $200 for subsequent violations. Other municipalities in Bucks County, such as Doylestown and Solebury, have already implemented or are considering similar bans on single-use plastics. This movement echoes a larger trend, with cities like Philadelphia and states including New Jersey enacting measures to reduce plastic use.
